reviews.review_msg: Ellie is an amazingly understanding and caring prof. This class was fascinating and due to such a small class size, we were able to really get into our discussions. We read a book each week, which was enjoyable but I found quite heavy. The discussions were relaxed and often went on interesting tangents and included personal topics. Loved this class

Ellie is is one of the best teachers I have had in my entire life. She is such a sweet person and is always accessible. Going to her class honestly made my day better and really motivated me to participate. The curriculum itself is not too intense and as long as you show effort you should get a good grade. Best academic decision I ever made.

Ellie cares and because she cares, it makes you want to care too. She's very passionate, very knowledgeable, and as long as you have educated opinions, you'll do well in terms of participation! Took this course about WWI and because of the content she selected, I'll never look at war the same again. 15/10, take her if you can, even for an elective!

I love this prof! amazing person and very passionate about her courses. I really recommend this course with her. you would enjoy it forsure.materials were  easy because you connect it to your personal life. Even though, she has high expectation .

Friendly and open-minded prof!  Participation is a large part of this class so be sure to talk a lot!  (The class went off tangents many times though, so participating doesn't require a lot of "intelligent" discussions all the time!)  Class isn't always interesting since it was 3 hrs long but good topics worth thinking about does come up.
A helpful prof and interesting course.  She's a very fair marker and papers are so short.    Great kind lady.
She is by far the best prof at SFU!

Ellie is a great facilitator of discussions in class and is quite approachable for help. The work load for Hum 330, 20th Cent Religious Autobiography, is interesting, but there is a decent amount of reading. She makes the papers fair though... I think there was only 3 and then a final. Nice person, good class, would take a class with her again.
